<title level="1" right="Focus 6" pfs="Standard">[Heroic Feat](/Spells.aspx?ID=754)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cursebound" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=320" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />
<trait label="Oracle" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=319" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 232 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Mystery**
[Battle](/Mysteries.aspx?ID=2)

<row gap="medium">

<row gap="tiny">
<row>**Cast**</row>
<row><actions string="Two Actions or Three Actions" /></row>
<row>[somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)</row>
</row>

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You gain the ability to perform a specialized combat technique from the vast wealth of martial knowledge your mystery provides. When you Cast this Spell, you use the action granted by one common [fighter feat](/Classes.aspx?ID=7/feats) from the _Core Rulebook_ or the _Advanced Player's Guide_ (your GM might add feats to this list). If you Cast this Spell using 2 actions, the granted action must be a single action, and if you Cast this Spell using 3 actions, you can instead choose a feat that grants a 2-action activity. The chosen feat's level can be no higher than _heroic feat's_ spell level. The feat can't have a Frequency entry, and you must meet its prerequisites and requirements in order to select it.
